title: Celebration plans in place as Mercedes close in on constructors' title
text:
Celebration plans in place as Mercedes close in on constructors' title 10 Oct 2015 18:01:57 
comments 
Mercedes' motorsport boss Toto Wolff has revealed the T-shirts which his team will wear to celebrate back-to-back constructors' championships have already been printed. 
The Silver Arrows are set to seal Formula One's team title in Russia on Sunday after Nico Rosberg and Lewis Hamilton locked out the front row in qualifying. 
Mercedes need to outscore their closest rivals Ferrari by only three points in Sochi, and with Sebastian Vettel and Kimi Raikkonen starting fourth and fifth, it appears somewhat of an inevitability. 
"The T-shirts are upstairs," said Wolff with a smile. "We can pretend tomorrow that we have not printed them, and then suddenly everybody wears one. 
"It is not a good omen to talk about T-shirts the day before the race but eventually we are going to wear them." 
Mercedes have dominated the sport for two years, and if they win the constructors' championship here on Sunday, they will have done so with four races to spare. Hamilton, 48 points clear of Rosberg, is also closing in on successive driver titles. 
"It will be a very big achievement," Wolff added. "It would be the second title and the constructors' championship makes us proud. We will add a little bit of history and nobody can take that away from us, so that is important. 
"What makes me particularly proud is that it is such a big group of individuals having worked so hard. I know that sounds boring, but it is an achievement of having built a car and an engine which is very dominating in an era." 
Mercedes have won 27 of the last 33 races, and have been on pole at all but one race this season - the only exception being in Singapore where they were mysteriously off the pace. 
Wolff added: "You just need to come out of that with a calm approach. We have done that. We bounced back in Suzuka and we have had a good day here. How the team keeps developing is just nice to be a part of. It is a really team effort." Related Sport News
